thread.title: Woman dies after falling from vehicle in central Christchurch
thread.title_full: Woman dies after falling from vehicle in central Christchurch

author: Jack Fletcher
title: Woman dies after falling from vehicle in central Christchurch
text:
Woman dies after falling from vehicle in central Christchurch JACK FLETCHER Last updated 12:54, February 24 2017 FACEBOOK 
Nicole Morris died after falling from a moving car on Bealey Ave. Police are now seeking the public's help in determining the circumstance of her death. 
A woman has died from her injuries after falling from a moving vehicle in central Christchurch. 
Nicole Morris, 30, was found on Bealey Ave at about 5.30pm on January 27, Detective Senior Sergeant Greg Cottam said. 
"She was seen falling on to the road between the intersections of Manchester St and Bishop St," Cottam said. 
"A motorist behind the vehicle she fell from stopped to help." 
She died on February 17 in Christchurch Hospital as a result of her injuries. 
Police are carrying out an investigation on behalf of the coroner into her death. 
"We are appealing for witnesses who saw Ms Morris fall from the car to come forward, particularly anyone who saw the vehicle she was in." 
The vehicle she was travelling in was a silver Ford Mondeo. 
"We'd like to thank the passersby who stopped and assisted Ms Morris at the time of the incident . . . now we need your help to explain the circumstances surrounding her death." 
Cottam said Morris' family had been spoken to and were being offered support. 
Anyone who witnessed her fall from the car or has any further information is asked to contact Christchurch police on 03 363 7400. 
Alternatively, information may be provided anonymously to Crimestoppers on 0800 555 111. - Stuff
